sub_title: PhD Candidate | Designer • Developing Evidence-Based Design for intelligent healthcare systems.
summary:
I am an enthusiastic design researcher, MSc graduate with a medical design specialisation. I have experience working with hospitals and data to improve user experience (UX) in the product and service design field.

I obtained an MSc in Integrated Product Design with a Medical Design specialisation at TU Delft, where I successfully defended my Master thesis and was awarded a perfect 10, received only by 1% of the students in my faculty. During my academic development, I worked closely with clinicians from Erasmus Medical Center and the Amsterdam University Medical Center to design connected care solutions based on data and human-centered design.

My design process is driven by empathy built within user research and the connections between the user and its context. I am skilled at online text analytics and user-centered design methods and tools to deliver research-based insights. I enjoy facilitating creative and co-creation sessions and follow an iterative approach that makes me embrace success and failure as part of my learning experience. These practices enable me to conceptualise and develop innovative and feasible propositions that result in value-driven integrated solutions.

I am a pro-active team player that believes a positive attitude is contagious. I feel comfortable working in a multicultural environment and enjoy creating a trustworthy atmosphere to improve collaboration. Additionally, working in healthcare has made me understand clinician’s mindsets and medical terminology, enhancing my persuasion and communication skills to inspire others in a multidisciplinary setting.

I see great opportunities for creating a systemic change in healthcare by bringing data science and human-centered design techniques together. Do you see the same? Feel free to send me an invitation on Linkedin to discuss the topic further!

As a graduate Master student, I collaborated with Erasmus Medical Center and Philips Design on the development of a smart Product-Service-System aiming to support children with heart defects to have an active life and decrease overprotection.

During my Graduation project, I developed:
━ A text analysis of 305 online stories from families of five countries using Natural-Language Processing methods.
━ User research using generative material for interviews with families and co-creation techniques with the medical team and professional designers.
━ A high-fidelity prototype of a smart Chatbot to explore the interaction with families and my service proposition.

Along with my Thesis, I accomplished:
━ The creation of a quantified user journey with 305 families that revealed the major moments and the family dynamics throughout the years.
━ The realisation of a user study using the Philips Data-Enable Design method with families for one week.

At the end of this project, I gained experience in:
━ Creative facilitation techniques within a multidisciplinary team of healthcare providers and professional designers.
━ Application of the Grounded Theory Method to conduct manual qualitative analysis.
━ Online text analysis with Machine Learning models to automate qualitative research on a large scale.

The project was developed under the mentorship of the CardioLab:
